results.title: Chest pain and Raynaud's phenomenon after COVID-19 vaccination in a patient previously diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus: a case report
results.text_hl: After the dose of @CHEMICAL_Azathioprine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001379 @@@azathioprine@@@ was increased from 25 to 50 mg/day along with increased @CHEMICAL_Prednisolone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011239 @@@prednisolone@@@ dose (10 mg/day), we added @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (5 mg/day) for @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary microvascular dysfunction@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud's phenomenon@@@.

citations.NLM: Kawano H, Umeda M, Okano S, Kudo T. Chest pain and Raynaud's phenomenon after COVID-19 vaccination in a patient previously diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus: a case report Eur Heart J Case Rep. 2023 Mar;7(3):ytad102. PMID: 36909840
citations.BibTeX: @article{36909840, title={Chest pain and Raynaud's phenomenon after COVID-19 vaccination in a patient previously diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus: a case report}, author={Kawano H and Umeda M and Okano S and Kudo T}, journal={Eur Heart J Case Rep}, volume={7}, number={3}, pages={ytad102}}

results.title: Silica associated systemic sclerosis: an occupational health hazard.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Tadalafil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068581 @@@Tadalafil@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ were given for his @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@pulmonary artery hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud's phenomenon@@@, respectively.

citations.NLM: Shivakumar DS, Kamath NS, Naik A. Silica associated systemic sclerosis: an occupational health hazard. BMJ Case Rep. 2023 Jan 17;16(1):. PMID: 36653045
citations.BibTeX: @article{36653045, title={Silica associated systemic sclerosis: an occupational health hazard.}, author={Shivakumar DS and Kamath NS and Naik A}, journal={BMJ Case Rep}, volume={16}, number={1}}

results.title: Emerging treatments for scleroderma/systemic sclerosis
results.text_hl: Mouth augmentation and oral stretching exercises are recommended for @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with reduced oral aperture. @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud's phenomenon@@@ is treated with a combination of lifestyle modification and calcium channel blockers, such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhu JL, Black SM, Chen HW, Jacobe HT. Emerging treatments for scleroderma/systemic sclerosis Fac Rev. 2021;10():43. PMID: 34131653
citations.BibTeX: @article{34131653, title={Emerging treatments for scleroderma/systemic sclerosis}, author={Zhu JL and Black SM and Chen HW and Jacobe HT}, journal={Fac Rev}, volume={10}, pages={43}}

results.title: Rational use of calcium-channel antagonists in Raynaud's phenomenon.
results.text_hl: The newer second-generation @CHEMICAL_Dihydropyridines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004095 @@@dihydropyridines@@@ such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Isradipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017275 @@@isradipine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Nicardipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009529 @@@nicardipine@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Felodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015736 @@@felodipine@@@ also appear to be effective in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@RP@@@ and may be associated with fewer adverse effects.

citations.NLM: Sturgill MG, Seibold JR. Rational use of calcium-channel antagonists in Raynaud's phenomenon. Curr Opin Rheumatol. 1998 Nov;10(6):584-8. PMID: 9812220
citations.BibTeX: @article{9812220, title={Rational use of calcium-channel antagonists in Raynaud's phenomenon.}, author={Sturgill MG and Seibold JR}, journal={Curr Opin Rheumatol}, volume={10}, number={6}, pages={584-8}}

results.title: Head-to-head comparison of udenafil vs amlodipine in the treatment of secondary Raynaud's phenomenon: a double-blind, randomized, cross-over study.
results.text_hl: Head-to-head comparison of @CHEMICAL_udenafil @CHEMICAL_MESH:C419664 @@@udenafil@@@ vs @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ in the treatment of secondary @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@Raynaud's phenomenon@@@: a double-blind, randomized, cross-over study.

citations.NLM: Lee EY, Park JK, Lee W, Kim YK, Park CS, Giles JT, Park JW, Shin K, Lee JS, Song YW, Lee EB. Head-to-head comparison of udenafil vs amlodipine in the treatment of secondary Raynaud's phenomenon: a double-blind, randomized, cross-over study. Rheumatology (Oxford). 2014 Apr;53(4):658-64. results.title: DHE-Induced Peripheral Arterial Vasospasm in Primary Raynaud Phenomenon: Case Report.
results.text_hl: Risk may be increased in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Raynaud_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011928 @@@primary Raynaud phenomenon@@@.

citations.NLM: Khalife J, Lauritsen CG, Liang J, Shah SO. DHE-Induced Peripheral Arterial Vasospasm in Primary Raynaud Phenomenon: Case Report. Neurohospitalist. 2019 Apr;9(2):113-115. PMID: 30915191
